title.narrative: OUTP 5.2: IMPROVED LEARNING OPPORTUNITIE

description.narrative: Output 5.2: Increased national capacity to provide access to age-appropriate, quality learning opportunities and minimize the effects of disasters on learning., which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By 2020, all boys and girls, including young people, have increased and more equitable access to, and completion of, quality, inclusive education, with improved learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.2: Increased national capacity to provide access to age-appropriate, quality learning opportunities and minimize theeffects of disasters on learning.

description.narrative: Over 281,000 learners (141,603 male and 140,252 female) benefitted from UNICEF’s support including printing and distributing 2,432,370 copies of Phase 4 (Grade 6) textbooks (achieving 100% of the target). UNICEF also procured and distributed 2,432,369 copies of Phase 5 (Grade 7) textbooks supported through donor funding. With UNICEF’s support, 952 primary teachers (46% female) were capacitated in effective teaching of Maths in 5 districts.;To improve the learning environment, UNICEF supported the provision of water in 340 schools in 15 disadvantaged districts through drilling and rehabilitation of boreholes benefitting174,209children.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
